trans-unit.source: Defines an interface for the Csc task to communicate with the Visual Studio IDE.
In particular, the Csc task delegates the actual compilation to the IDE rather than shelling out to the command-line compilers.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_True" name="True" href=""></xref> to set the `/ highentropyva` to indicate support of high entropy Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR); otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_False" name="False" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_True" name="True" href=""></xref> if the method was successful.
Sets the `/platform` value to <xref uid="langword_csharp_AnyCPU32BitPreferred" name="AnyCPU32BitPreferred" href=""></xref>.

If the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ManagedCompiler.Prefer32Bit%2A> property is set on the project, SetPlatformWith32BitPreference changes the `/platform` value from `AnyCPU` or the default value (`null` or "") to `AnyCPU32BitPreferred`.
If the `/platform` value is set to `AnyCPU` (`/platform:AnyCPU`), your application runs as a 64-bit process whenever possible and falls back to 32-bit for 32-bit-only systems.
However, you might prefer an application to run as a 32-bit process because 64-bit applications may consume more memory.
The `AnyCPU32BitPreferred` setting is similar to `AnyCPU`, except that its default action is to run applications in 32-bit mode on systems that support either mode.
This setting accommodates future processors that may not fall back to 32-bit mode.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to set the `/platform` value to <xref uid="langword_csharp_AnyCPU32BitPreferred" name="AnyCPU32BitPreferred" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the method was successful.
Sets the subsystem version flag as specified.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the method succeeds.
